subject: Re: [junit] Re: Javadocing test case and other test classes?
msgSnippet: ... To date, I ve only done (c).  I m not saying that s right or wrong, just my way so far. ... Mike Clark Clarkware Consulting, Inc. http://clarkware.com
messageBody:
On Jan 5, 2005, at 3:50 PM, Harald M. Muller wrote:

>
> a)/b) did you javadoc these classes - which might be interesting for
> the
> API user as useful small examples? -
> a) in the Javadoc of the library (where they clutter up the "real API",
> but are readily available)
> b) in a separate Javadoc?
>
> c) Or do you deliver the examples as code only and point the users to
> some test/examples directory, without giving them Javadoc for those
> classes?

To date, I've only done (c). I'm not saying that's right or wrong,
just my way so far.

---
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
http://clarkware.com
